primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God intervenes in a dying world to raise Jesus from the dead, an act that is qualitatively different from nature and human expectation, creating a new reality that the church witnesses to.

tekstueel_bewijs: something utterly new and unlooked for has been done by God
God who 'calls into existence the things that do not exist'
the risen Lord was going before them... creating the new conditions

object.identificatie: Resurrection (The reversal of death/The New Creation)

zender.identificatie: God the Father / The Biblical Decree
tekstueel_bewijs: God decreed death... But the decree has been set aside
Christ has entered death... for our sakes
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver (the one who is terrified and then gifted).

helper.identificatie: The Witnesses / The Angel / The Preacher
tekstueel_bewijs: the message of the young man
the preacher is... one who testifies
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject; Christ is the Mediator/First-fruits.
helper.rol_van_geest: Implicitly the power that enables faith/trust in the witness.

tegenstander.identificatie: Death, Nature, and Human Misunderstanding (Generic Easter)
tekstueel_bewijs: resistance to the real message... is deeply entrenched
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Death is treated as an ontological wall that nature cannot scale; only a 'mighty event from beyond nature' can overcome it.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The hearer's transition from fear/anesthetization to witnessing and trust.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer/The Church
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (witnessing) is entirely dependent on the primary program (God's act of raising Jesus).

voorbeelden_god_subject: God has done something utterly new.
The risen Lord was already creating the new conditions.
God decreed death... the decree has been set aside [by God].
voorbeelden_mens_subject: The women fled from the tomb.
We have no human right to hope for it.

voorbeelden: we are just going to have to get used to this
we no longer hear it as it was meant to be heard
I don't 'know' it exactly... it is a gift of faith
Christ... has wrested supremacy away from them forever.
God who calls into existence the things that do not exist.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's 'ability' (Pouvoir) to do what is impossible for man. It rejects the 'Devoir' (moralism) of self-improvement.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from ~S1 (Generic Easter) to S2 (The reality of the grave) to S1 (The radical act of God).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found only in the 'unlooked-for reversal' by God, not in natural cycles.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; death is described as a 'torment' and 'furrows'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. God is the primary actor; the human role is reduced to 'trembling' and 'witnessing.'

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of active verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God has done something utterly new.
Christ has entered death and descended into hell... and has wrested supremacy away.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The women are not models of faith to emulate, but models of human inadequacy in the face of God's power.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides the theocentric reading: their fear proves the magnitude of God's act.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; the burden of 'saving oneself' or 'renewing oneself' is removed.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation: God acts, man receives.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative is perfectly integrated; the 'strange ending' of Mark serves the theological point of God's transcendence.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'knowing' and 'trusting' is the only friction point.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: wrested supremacy away from them forever

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is not mentioned by name, but the 'gift of faith' implies the Spirit's work.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin/Death is a decree that only God can set aside.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject and the Resurrection as a divine intrusion rather than a human potential.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is appropriate for an Easter sermon.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Strongly defined as the 'furrows of the grave'.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God's act) correctly precedes and grounds the secondary program of Witness.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in theocentric preaching that avoids the trap of moralistic 'renewal' language.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'Easter card' metaphor, Greimasian analysis reveals that the metaphor serves to distinguish between two different Subjects (Nature vs. God).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Mark 16:8; semiotics shows how the preacher uses that 'fear' to strip the hearer of actantial agency, making them a pure Receiver.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that 'Generic Easter' is a narrative where Nature is the Subject, whereas 'Real Easter' is a narrative where God is the Subject.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a perfect example of Rutledge's grammar of grace.
